document_title: Left-sided migraine: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Some statistics show that more than 50% of adults worldwide have headaches. The pain can spread throughout the head or just in one location, such as a left migraine or a right migraine.
When having a left-sided migraine, the patient will feel pain spreading throughout the first half of the head, a mild dull pain or sharp pain in a certain position on the left side of the head, severe pain, sharp pain.
Along with left-sided migraine symptoms, there are many other signs such as drooping eyelids, blurred vision, watery eyes, impaired vision, neck and shoulder tension, nausea, vomiting, dizziness, etc. Migraines The left head can also make the patient more sensitive to light, sound, scents, etc.
In particular, depending on the cause of the headache, you may notice that the pain gets worse in the evening or at some time during the day, such as when you first wake up.
Left-sided migraine can be accompanied by other symptoms such as dizziness, vertigo, nausea, etc.
